thread.title: Principal Seeks Asset Managers as New CEO Confronts Volatility

author: Katherine Chiglinsky
title: Principal Seeks Asset Managers as New CEO Confronts Volatility
text:
Principal Financial Group Inc.’s new chief executive officer is planning to build the insurer’s asset-management unit and is considering investments in timber and infrastructure to limit risks tied to financial markets.
“We’re always actively looking for the next non-correlated investment operation that would be additive to our line-up,” CEO Daniel Houston, 54, said in an interview Wednesday in New York. “We have what I consider to be a very active pipeline, looking for the appropriate asset classes that support long-term retirement savings.”
Principal Global Investors, the asset-management arm led by Jim McCaughan, has purchased stakes in boutiques such as Liongate Capital Management LLP and Columbus Circle Investors. Des Moines, Iowa-based Principal also bought Origin Asset Management in 2011 to push into emerging markets.
Insurers have been moving beyond bonds in recent years to improve returns on their own funds or attract third-party clients looking to diversify risks. XL Group Plc’s CEO Mike McGavick said in May that his company was turning to infrastructure investments to boost yields . TIAA-CREF started a $667 million timber venture in June.
“We’re looking for certainty and we’re looking for something that allows people to sleep well at night,” Houston said. “Not a lot of volatility.”
Principal has expanded its operations into nations including Chile, Mexico and Brazil, and more than quadrupled its assets under management since going public in 2001. Houston, who joined in 1984 and took over as CEO in August from Larry Zimpleman, said Principal will focus on strengthening its position in international markets where it already has a foothold.
“On the next dollar we invest, is it to go deep where we’re at, and make sure that we secure the fort? Or do we dilute ourselves and go to these other markets?” he said. One of his priorities is “certainly making sure that we have secured our position.”
